intro: Thymus longicaulis var. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate woolly thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, aromatic leaves that are typically gray-green in color, covered in fine, fuzzy hairs. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for both garden use and herbal purposes.
